etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From pyro- + -one, after German Pyron

definitions: Each of two unsaturated, heterocyclic ketones having the formula C₅ H₄ O₂, specifically γ-pyrone.

notes.text: The pyrones are keto derivatives of the pyrans; the commoner isomer, "γ-pyrone", is a colourless, basic, crystalline solid, CH=CHOCH=CHCO.
